tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE customer_consent_data (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  customer_name VARCHAR(50),
  consent_given BOOLEAN,
  consent_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE consent_logs (
   log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
   customer_id INT,
   consent_date DATE,
   consent_type VARCHAR(50),
   FOREIGN KEY (customer_id) REFERENCES customers(customer_id)
);

CREATE TABLE customer (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  name VARCHAR(50),
  email VARCHAR(100),
  phone VARCHAR(20),
  consent_given BOOLEAN
);

CREATE TABLE customer_consent (
  customer_id INT,
  consent_type_id INT,
  consent_date TIMESTAMP,
  FOREIGN KEY (customer_id) REFERENCES customer(id),
  FOREIGN KEY (consent_type_id) REFERENCES consent_type(id)
);

CREATE TABLE consent_log (
  log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  customer_id INT,
  action VARCHAR(20),
  log_date TIMESTAMP,
  FOREIGN KEY (customer_id) REFERENCES customer(id)
);

CREATE TABLE customer (
    customer_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    first_name VARCHAR(50),
    last_name VARCHAR(50),
    email VARCHAR(100),
    phone_number VARCHAR(15),
    consent_given BOOLEAN
);

CREATE TABLE customer_consent (
    customer_id INT,
    consent_type_id INT,
    consent_date DATE,
    FOREIGN KEY (customer_id) REFERENCES customer(customer_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (consent_type_id) REFERENCES consent_type(consent_type_id)
);

CREATE TABLE consent_audit (
    audit_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    customer_id INT,
    consent_type_id INT,
    action_performed VARCHAR(50),
    action_timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (customer_id) REFERENCES customer(customer_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (consent_type_id) REFERENCES consent_type(consent_type_id)
);

CREATE TABLE audit_log (
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    audit_id INT,
    log_description TEXT,
    log_timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (audit_id) REFERENCES consent_audit(audit_id)
);
